title.rendered: Student Behavior Expectations on School Buses

content.rendered:
Bus behavior expectations are posted on all district school buses. When students follow these expectations, it helps to ensure a safe environment on the school bus for all students. Please review these with your students so they will understand that the school bus is an extension of the classroom and the behavioral expectations in the classroom also apply to school buses. 

  • Follow driver instructions the first time.
  • Stay seated in your assigned seat at all times.
  • Keep aisle, windows & emergency exits clear.
  • Use an inside voice at all times (Level 1-2).
  • Keep body parts/objects to yourself.
  • Treat others with respect at all times.
  • Headphones must always be used.
  • No inappropriate use of technology devices.
  • No photos, videos or laser pointers allowed.
  • No profanity or rude behavior.
  • No tobacco products or illegal substances.
  • No eating/drinking & keep your bus clean.
  • No hazardous items or fragrances allowed.

Violations of the rules above may result in the following consequences:

  • warning
  • assigned seat
  • parent phone call
  • bus suspension
  • restitution for damages
